events.source_text: 7.  On 11 July 2003 the Ukrainian Parliament adopted the Code on the Execution of Sentences of Ukraine (“the Code”).
events.event_what: Law introduced amendments to the Code, entitling all life prisoners to one short visit every month and one long visit every three months.

events.source_text: 7.  On 11 July 2003 the Ukrainian Parliament adopted the Code on the Execution of Sentences of Ukraine (“the Code”).
events.event_what: Amendments to Article 151 of the Code, entitling all life prisoners to one long visit every two months.

events.source_text: 1.  The case originated in three applications against Ukraine lodged with the Court under Article 34 of the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms (“the Convention”) by three Ukrainian nationals: Mr Mikhail Igorevich Belyayev (“the first applicant” application no.
events.event_what: The respondent State is ordered to pay EUR 3,000 to the first applicant and EUR 1,500 each to the second and third applicants for non-pecuniary damage.
